list.name: Default
list.comment: Start with current binding to allow access to existing classes http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16826014/embedded-groovy-console-how-do-i-share-entire-state

task.summary: Default task
Refactor to use ImapAccount structured type instead of many standalone options like host, port, type, login and password.
1) Introduce CommandLine parsing (keys -h/-c). 2) Add option and mode save/restore gathering information into XML to speedup many processing and investigation procedures from full cache.

1) Add logging also into file by default 2) -Add 'print-depth' option which mean: Max amount of nesting folders print. By default all. Starts from 1, so only root folder will be printed. 2 means also 1st level childs and so on. 3) In default config move xml files into results dir and ignore it in git
Cache now written per account and used also.
Implement configurable 'operations' behaviour (Base folderPrintSize as default and example implemented). Does NOT work with message processing instantiated from cache.
Serious refactor to allow process each message in operations. Lazy initialize session, store and folder loggers.

Implement ExtendedConfig and options to override any path from commandline like: --config operations.printFolderSizes.folder='{true}' --config operations.printFolderSizes.message='{m-> println "SUBJ: ${m.subject}"}'
Rename main entrypoint script to just ImapTree

1) Make some classes static type checked (annotate @CompileStatic): Spent, Size (already was), ConfigExtended, ImapAccount 2) Import from ais adapter utils.bench package. Adopt and refactor Spent, ProgressLogger (expand docs, add examples) 3) Add progress logging into ImapTree. 4) Introduce first test - change project layout. But groovy-tests are not runned from Idea directly and JetBrains bugtracker https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/ down. See SpentTest.groovy for more details. 5) Add .idea directory under versioning control.
In progressLogger add ability process streams without known capacity. Add logging for Imap tre traversal.
@XStreamOmitField ProgressLogger pl
Add default operation GroovyConsole on result

1) Introduce sub-package config 2) New Class Operation and config rewrite. Add hook after folder messages process. 3) Enhance ConfigExtended to override properties instead of just replace objects in config.
Add Operation.clone() method, update GroovyConsole operation example.
Fix ProgressLogger on empty list
In Operation clone and redelegate closure to properly handle properties.
Add xStream custom NontSaveConverter and on unmarshaling phase (in two step now from static factory) provide new constructed lazy store and loggers from it.
ConfigExtended expand doc and example about quoting path literals: config.setFromPropertyPathLikeKey('some.test.s', '"s CHANGED"');
Implement gmailTrueDeleteMessages operation!
Solve Operation closures redelegation problem (access to config). Import DelegateBase class
Adjust config usage in examples.
Just Typo in comments
Add example of direct access to the folder and messages from GroovyConsole

MESSAGE.value: Refactor to use ImapAccount structured type instead of many standalone options like host, port, type, login and password.
1) Introduce CommandLine parsing (keys -h/-c). 2) Add option and mode save/restore gathering information into XML to speedup many processing and investigation procedures from full cache.

1) Add logging also into file by default 2) -Add 'print-depth' option which mean: Max amount of nesting folders print. By default all. Starts from 1, so only root folder will be printed. 2 means also 1st level childs and so on. 3) In default config move xml files into results dir and ignore it in git
Cache now written per account and used also.
Implement configurable 'operations' behaviour (Base folderPrintSize as default and example implemented). Does NOT work with message processing instantiated from cache.
Serious refactor to allow process each message in operations. Lazy initialize session, store and folder loggers.

Implement ExtendedConfig and options to override any path from commandline like: --config operations.printFolderSizes.folder='{true}' --config operations.printFolderSizes.message='{m-> println "SUBJ: ${m.subject}"}'

Implement ExtendedConfig and options to override any path from commandline like: --config operations.printFolderSizes.folder='{true}' --config operations.printFolderSizes.message='{m-> println "SUBJ: ${m.subject}"}'
Rename main entrypoint script to just ImapTree

1) Make some classes static type checked (annotate @CompileStatic): Spent, Size (already was), ConfigExtended, ImapAccount 2) Import from ais adapter utils.bench package. Adopt and refactor Spent, ProgressLogger (expand docs, add examples) 3) Add progress logging into ImapTree. 4) Introduce first test - change project layout. But groovy-tests are not runned from Idea directly and JetBrains bugtracker https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/ down. See SpentTest.groovy for more details. 5) Add .idea directory under versioning control.
In progressLogger add ability process streams without known capacity. Add logging for Imap tre traversal.
@XStreamOmitField ProgressLogger pl
Add default operation GroovyConsole on result

1) Introduce sub-package config 2) New Class Operation and config rewrite. Add hook after folder messages process. 3) Enhance ConfigExtended to override properties instead of just replace objects in config.
Add Operation.clone() method, update GroovyConsole operation example.
Fix ProgressLogger on empty list
In Operation clone and redelegate closure to properly handle properties.
Add xStream custom NontSaveConverter and on unmarshaling phase (in two step now from static factory) provide new constructed lazy store and loggers from it.
ConfigExtended expand doc and example about quoting path literals: config.setFromPropertyPathLikeKey('some.test.s', '"s CHANGED"');
Implement gmailTrueDeleteMessages operation!
Solve Operation closures redelegation problem (access to config). Import DelegateBase class
Adjust config usage in examples.
Just Typo in comments
Add example of direct access to the folder and messages from GroovyConsole
Start with current binding to allow access to existing classes http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16826014/embedded-groovy-console-how-do-i-share-entire-state
